scheme_data.description:
The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE-Technical Book Writing & Translation Scheme. It is also known as ATBWT. AICTE-Technical Book Writing &amp; Translation scheme has been launched by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to promote the use of &#39;Scheduled Regional Language&#39; in Technical Education for creating knowledge base in local language and to encourage creation of treasure of latest technical knowledge incorporating the newest developments by grant of financial support to the distinguished faculty/writers/translators.
> Objectives:

To encourage, promote and support maximum number of writers to write and publish the technical subject books in Indian scheduled regional language including Hindi.
> List of (12) Scheduled Regional Languages included in Technical Book Writing Scheme of AICTE:


   1. Hindi.
   1. Assamese.
   1. Bengali.
   1. Gujarati.
   1. Kannada.
   1. Malayalam.
   1. Marathi.
   1. Odia.
   1. Punjabi.
   1. Tamil.
   1. Telugu.
   1. Urdu. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Maximum funding for translation work and for original Technical Book Writing (Funding will be shared in case of multiple authors) shall be limited to :

Original book writer for UG : ₹ 2,00,000/Original book writer for Diploma : ₹ 1,50,000/Reviewer for UG: ₹ 40,000/Reviewer for Diploma: ₹ 30,000/Translator for UG & Diploma: ₹ 1,00,000/Reviewer of translated books in regional languages for UG & Diploma: ₹  20,000/(In case of an author & coauthor for one book, the amount will be split between the both).

Eligibility criteria include: The Facultyretired or working in AICTE approved institutions (Degree/Diploma/Pharmacy/Management/Architecture etc.) or researchers of suchinstitutions.
The proposed author(s) to be of reputed with command over the subject and the language chosen for writing.
The proposed author(s) should have a proven academic record of brilliance.
The proposed author(s) should have been recognized in the similar nature work earlier. The application process is as follows: Kindly visit AICTE Website > Schemes > Staff Development Schemes > Technical Book Writing and Translation or visit https://www.aicteindia.org/schemes/staffdevelopmentschemesClick and download the Application for Technical Book Writing and Translation.
Fill in the required information.
Verify that every page of the application form has signature and stamp of the Institute’s Head.
Attach all the essential documents along with the filled application form.
Kindly ensure all the information is correct and then send the Application form along with all the essential documents through registered post/ speed post to:

> Prof. Dileep N Malkhede,

> Adviser RIFD

> All India Council for Technical Education,

> Nelson Madela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi 110070 For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/fdc/DEC%202021%20TBW%20SCHEME%20DOCUMENT.pdf Application Form: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/technical%20book%20writing%20form%20%281%29.pdf Procedure To Apply: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/STEPS%20TO%20APPLY%20FOR%20TBW.pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Financial Support, Remuneration, Technical Book Writing, Translation.

scheme_data.combined_text:
The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE-Technical Book Writing & Translation Scheme. It is also known as ATBWT. AICTE-Technical Book Writing & Translation scheme has been launched by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to promote the use of 'Scheduled Regional Language' in Technical Education for creating knowledge base in local language and to encourage creation of treasure of latest technical knowledge incorporating the newest developments by grant of financial support to the distinguished faculty/writers/translators. > Objectives: To encourage, promote and support maximum number of writers to write and publish the technical subject books in Indian scheduled regional language including Hindi. > List of (12) Scheduled Regional Languages included in Technical Book Writing Scheme of AICTE: 1. Hindi. 1. Assamese. 1. Bengali. 1. Gujarati. 1. Kannada. 1. Malayalam. 1. Marathi. 1. Odia. 1. Punjabi. 1. Tamil. 1. Telugu. 1. Urdu. The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual. Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education. The scheme provides the following benefits: Maximum funding for translation work and for original Technical Book Writing (Funding will be shared in case of multiple authors) shall be limited to : Original book writer for UG : ₹ 2,00,000/Original book writer for Diploma : ₹ 1,50,000/Reviewer for UG: ₹ 40,000/Reviewer for Diploma: ₹ 30,000/Translator for UG & Diploma: ₹ 1,00,000/Reviewer of translated books in regional languages for UG & Diploma: ₹ 20,000/(In case of an author & coauthor for one book, the amount will be split between the both). Eligibility criteria include: The Facultyretired or working in AICTE approved institutions (Degree/Diploma/Pharmacy/Management/Architecture etc.) or researchers of suchinstitutions. The proposed author(s) to be of reputed with command over the subject and the language chosen for writing. The proposed author(s) should have a proven academic record of brilliance. The proposed author(s) should have been recognized in the similar nature work earlier. The application process is as follows: Kindly visit AICTE Website > Schemes > Staff Development Schemes > Technical Book Writing and Translation or visit https://www.aicteindia.org/schemes/staffdevelopmentschemesClick and download the Application for Technical Book Writing and Translation. Fill in the required information. Verify that every page of the application form has signature and stamp of the Institute’s Head. Attach all the essential documents along with the filled application form. Kindly ensure all the information is correct and then send the Application form along with all the essential documents through registered post/ speed post to: > Prof. Dileep N Malkhede, > Adviser RIFD > All India Council for Technical Education, > Nelson Madela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi 110070 For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/fdc/DEC%202021%20TBW%20SCHEME%20DOCUMENT.pdf Application Form: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/technical%20book%20writing%20form%20%281%29.pdf Procedure To Apply: https://www.aicte-india.org/sites/default/files/STEPS%20TO%20APPLY%20FOR%20TBW.pdf sentences.sent: The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE-Technical Book Writing & Translation Scheme.
It is also known as ATBWT.

AICTE-Technical Book Writing &amp; Translation scheme has been launched by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to promote the use of &#39;Scheduled Regional Language&#39; in Technical Education for creating knowledge base in local language and to encourage creation of treasure of latest technical knowledge incorporating the newest developments by grant of financial support to the distinguished faculty/writers/translators.
> Objectives: To encourage, promote and support maximum number of writers to write and publish the technical subject books in Indian scheduled regional language including Hindi.
> List of (12) Scheduled Regional Languages included in Technical Book Writing Scheme of AICTE: 1.
The scheme targets beneficiaries such as Individual.
Additionally, the nodal ministry is Ministry of Education and the nodal department is Department Of Higher Education.

The scheme provides the following benefits: Maximum funding for translation work and for original Technical Book Writing (Funding will be shared in case of multiple authors) shall be limited to : Original book writer for UG : ₹ 2,00,000/Original book writer for Diploma : ₹ 1,50,000/Reviewer for UG: ₹ 40,000/Reviewer for Diploma: ₹ 30,000/Translator for UG & Diploma: ₹ 1,00,000/Reviewer of translated books in regional languages for UG & Diploma: ₹ 20,000/(In case of an author & coauthor for one book, the amount will be split between the both).
Eligibility criteria include: The Facultyretired or working in AICTE approved institutions (Degree/Diploma/Pharmacy/Management/Architecture etc.
The proposed author(s) to be of reputed with command over the subject and the language chosen for writing.
The proposed author(s) should have a proven academic record of brilliance.
The proposed author(s) should have been recognized in the similar nature work earlier.
The application process is as follows: Kindly visit AICTE Website > Schemes > Staff Development Schemes > Technical Book Writing and Translation or visit https://www.
org/schemes/staffdevelopmentschemesClick and download the Application for Technical Book Writing and Translation.
Verify that every page of the application form has signature and stamp of the Institute’s Head.
Attach all the essential documents along with the filled application form.
Kindly ensure all the information is correct and then send the Application form along with all the essential documents through registered post/ speed post to: > Prof.
Dileep N Malkhede, > Adviser RIFD > All India Council for Technical Education, > Nelson Madela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi 110070 For more information, please refer to: Guidelines: https://www.
pdf Tags associated with the scheme include: Financial Support, Remuneration, Technical Book Writing, Translation.

tagged_ctus.text: The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE-Technical Book Writing & Translation Scheme. It is also known as ATBWT. AICTE-Technical Book Writing &amp; Translation scheme has been launched by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to promote the use of &#39;Scheduled Regional Language&#39; in Technical Education for creating knowledge base in local language and to encourage creation of treasure of latest technical knowledge incorporating the newest developments by grant of financial support to the distinguished faculty/writers/translators. The scheme provides the following benefits: Maximum funding for translation work and for original Technical Book Writing (Funding will be shared in case of multiple authors) shall be limited to : Original book writer for UG : ₹ 2,00,000/Original book writer for Diploma : ₹ 1,50,000/Reviewer for UG: ₹ 40,000/Reviewer for Diploma: ₹ 30,000/Translator for UG & Diploma: ₹ 1,00,000/Reviewer of translated books in regional languages for UG & Diploma: ₹ 20,000/(In case of an author & coauthor for one book, the amount will be split between the both). Eligibility criteria include: The Facultyretired or working in AICTE approved institutions (Degree/Diploma/Pharmacy/Management/Architecture etc. ) or researchers of suchinstitutions.

The proposed author(s) to be of reputed with command over the subject and the language chosen for writing. The proposed author(s) should have a proven academic record of brilliance. The proposed author(s) should have been recognized in the similar nature work earlier. 
> **Objectives:**

To encourage, promote and support maximum number of writers to write and publish the technical subject books in Indian scheduled regional language including Hindi. 
> **List of (12) Scheduled Regional Languages included in Technical Book Writing Scheme of AICTE:**


 1. Hindi.

\n 1. Assamese. \n 1. prompts.ctu_text: The name of this welfare scheme is AICTE-Technical Book Writing & Translation Scheme. It is also known as ATBWT. AICTE-Technical Book Writing &amp; Translation scheme has been launched by the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) to promote the use of &#39;Scheduled Regional Language&#39; in Technical Education for creating knowledge base in local language and to encourage creation of treasure of latest technical knowledge incorporating the newest developments by grant of financial support to the distinguished faculty/writers/translators. The scheme provides the following benefits: Maximum funding for translation work and for original Technical Book Writing (Funding will be shared in case of multiple authors) shall be limited to : Original book writer for UG : ₹ 2,00,000/Original book writer for Diploma : ₹ 1,50,000/Reviewer for UG: ₹ 40,000/Reviewer for Diploma: ₹ 30,000/Translator for UG & Diploma: ₹ 1,00,000/Reviewer of translated books in regional languages for UG & Diploma: ₹ 20,000/(In case of an author & coauthor for one book, the amount will be split between the both). Eligibility criteria include: The Facultyretired or working in AICTE approved institutions (Degree/Diploma/Pharmacy/Management/Architecture etc. ) or researchers of suchinstitutions.
